com.github.xemiru.general

Class Arguments

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.xemiru.general.Arguments

  • public class Arguments
extends Object
    Acts as a stack for command parameters, enabling advanced parameter handling.

    • Nested Class Summary

      • setContext

        public Arguments setContext(CommandContext newContext)
        Sets the new CommandContext of this Arguments object.

        The new context cannot be null.

        Parameters:
        newContext - the new context
        Returns:
        this Arguments

      • getSyntax

        public String getSyntax()
        Returns:
        the syntax generated by this Arguments object as a result of calls to the write methods

      • complete

        public List<String> complete()
        Suggests completion for the last written raw argument.

        The list may return empty if there are no suggested completions.

        Returns:
        a List of suggestions to finish the last written argument (can be empty)

      • next

        public <T> T next()
        Returns the next parameter that was successfully parsed.

        The order of the parameters is set by the order of the calls to the write methods. Each call to a write method will add to the parameters held by this Arguments object.

        Any syntax errors withheld by calls the write methods will be thrown when calling this method -- this allows the syntax string to be generated.

        If there are no more parameters, this method throws an IllegalStateException.

        If the context denotes that the command using these Arguments is being dry-ran, this method throws an IllegalStateException.

        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of the parameter
        Returns:
        the next parameter successfully parsed
        Throws:
        ClassCastException - if the requested parameter type did not match the actual
        IllegalStateException - if no more parameters are held by this Arguments object
        SyntaxException - if syntax errors had occured during argument parsing

      • nextParameter

        public <T> Arguments.Parameter<T> nextParameter()
        Returns the next parameter that was successfully parsed.

        The order of the parameters is set by the order of the calls to the write methods. Each call to a write method will add to the parameters held by this Arguments object.

        Any syntax errors withheld by calls the write methods will be thrown when calling this method -- this allows the syntax string to be generated.

        If there are no more parameters, this method throws an IllegalStateException.

        If the context denotes that the command using these Arguments is being dry-ran, this method throws an IllegalStateException.

        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of the parameter
        Returns:
        the next parameter successfully parsed
        Throws:
        ClassCastException - if the requested parameter type did not match the actual
        IllegalStateException - if no more parameters are held by this Arguments object
        SyntaxException - if syntax errors had occured during argument parsing

      • drop

        public Arguments drop(int n)
        Drops the earliest n parameters in this Arguments object's parsing history.

        Use with care. An ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException can be thrown if not enough parsers were written, or if parser handling had errored with the latter only showing having occured through a call to next().

        This will also drop corresponding syntax, but will not drop raw arguments.

        Parameters:
        n - the amount of parameters to drop
        Returns:
        this Arguments

      • getRaw

        public RawArguments getRaw()
        Returns:
        the RawArguments used by this Arguments object

      • named

        public <T> Arguments named(String typename,
                           ArgumentParser<T> parser)
        Writes a parameter to this set of arguments using the provided ArgumentParser.

        The typename of the provided parser is renamed.

        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of the resulting parameter
        Parameters:
        typename - the typename to identify with
        parser - the parser to use
        Returns:
        this Arguments

      • named

        public <T> Arguments named(String typename,
                           ArgumentParser<T> parser,
                           Predicate<T> check)
        Writes a parameter to this set of arguments using the provided ArgumentParser and checks it using the given Predicate.

        The typename of the provided parser is renamed.

        The default error message for a parameter failing the Predicate's check is "invalid value." This can be changed using write(ArgumentParser, Predicate, String).

        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of the resulting parameter
        Parameters:
        typename - the typename to identify with
        parser - the parser converting the raw argument into a usable parameter
        check - the predicate checking whether the resulting parameter is usable
        Returns:
        this Arguments

      • named

        public <T> Arguments named(String typename,
                           ArgumentParser<T> parser,
                           Predicate<T> check,
                           String errorMsg)
        Writes a parameter to this set of arguments using the provided ArgumentParser and checks it using the given Predicate.

        The typename of the provided parser is renamed.

        Note that the error message is always appended with the string that the passed ArgumentParser deemed invalid. Specifically, the message becomes "message: string".

        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of the resulting parameter
        Parameters:
        typename - the typename to identify with
        parser - the parser converting the raw argument into a usable parameter
        check - the predicate checking whether the resulting parameter is usable
        errorMsg - the error message sent when the predicate fails to verify the resulting parameter
        Returns:
        this Arguments

      • write

        public <T> Arguments write(ArgumentParser<T> parser)
        Writes a parameter to this set of arguments using the provided ArgumentParser.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of the resulting parameter
        Parameters:
        parser - the parser converting the raw argument into a usable parameter
        Returns:
        this Arguments

      • write

        public <T> Arguments write(ArgumentParser<T> parser,
                           Predicate<T> check)
        Writes a parameter to this set of arguments using the provided ArgumentParser and checks it using the given Predicate.

        The default error message for a parameter failing the Predicate's check is "invalid value." This can be changed using write(ArgumentParser, Predicate, String).

        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of the resulting parameter
        Parameters:
        parser - the parser converting the raw argument into a usable parameter
        check - the predicate checking whether the resulting parameter is usable
        Returns:
        this Arguments

      • write

        public <T> Arguments write(ArgumentParser<T> parser,
                           Predicate<T> check,
                           String errorMsg)
        Writes a parameter to this set of arguments using the provided ArgumentParser and checks it using the given Predicate.

        Note that the error message is always appended with the string that the passed ArgumentParser deemed invalid. Specifically, the message becomes "message: string".

        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of the resulting parameter
        Parameters:
        parser - the parser converting the raw argument into a usable parameter
        check - the predicate checking whether the resulting parameter is usable
        errorMsg - the error message sent when the predicate fails to verify the resulting parameter
        Returns:
